citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a formal arrangement with a veterinarian or a written program of veterinary care for their
exhibited chickens. A written program of veterinary care is necessary to ensure the health and well-being of the birds. The
facility shall establish a formal arrangement with their attending veterinarian for the birds including a written program of
veterinary care. Correct by March 28th, 2024.

A rabbit named Thumper was housed in the feed room of a horse barn while receiving medical care. On May 2, 2023, the
rabbit was found dead within the enclosure. The plastic flap covering the cat door leading into the feed room as well as
the door to the enclosure were ripped off. Per a facility representative, a predator likely entered through the cat door and
caused the rabbit’s death. The rabbit’s enclosure was not adequately enclosed to prevent predator access and protect the
rabbit. Housing facilities for rabbits shall be fenced or otherwise enclosed to prevent the entrance of predators. Corrected
at the time of inspection.

On January 23, 2023, three deer were found dead within their enclosure. Per a facility representative, a predator most
likely caused their death. The facility did not know what type of predator and was not able to clearly identify the entrance
point but did find a gap beneath an area of the back fence. The primary enclosure did not prevent predator access and did
not protect the animals from injury. Furthermore, there were significant gaps at the bottom of the fence in many areas of
the goat’s enclosure. Those gaps could result in animal injury or escape. The facility must maintain enclosures in good
repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain them safely. Correct by April 28, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written environmental enhancement plan for the birds on hand. A written plan is necessary to
ensure that the overall health, well-being, and psychological needs of the birds are being appropriately met. The facility
must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the
psychological well-being of all the birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be in
accordance with currently accepted professional standards. Correct by March 28th, 2024.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There was a large accumulation of feces at the top of the platform leading into 2 of the 4 chicken coops. The chickens
have to walk through the waste accumulation to get into the coop. Excessive accumulation of feces within an enclosure
may cause soiling of the birds contained within and can lead to odors, pests, and disease. The facility must establish a
system for timely removal of waste material to prevent excessive accumulation within the enclosures. Correct by March
8th, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
